Different concentrations of CA-III were injected in the chromatographic system containing a constant concentration (0.24 mM) of analytes (12a–16a) in the mobile phase. HPLC quantification was generated with Shimadzu’s LC-solution software coupled with Shimadzu instrument. Absorbance (A) as a response in terms of detector signal is obtained from the negative-peak area determination. This response was utilised to measure the concentration or amount of the ligand bound with the CA-III enzyme [ I B ], by dividing the area obtained for absorbance of negative peak by absorptivity (a) of the standard ligand with known concentration according to Beer–Lambert law:
